name: Xanadu Island Resort Belize

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is situated at the bottom of the strip. So it's still near everything with out being noisy. It has it's own lush gardens and private pier. The pool is heated and very cozy. The staff is wonderful and very accommodating. We had a great stay.
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel close to San Pedro but out of the busy city. It's on the beach, with a wonderful pool and grounds. One note however, the upstairs rooms require walking up quite a few stairs including a spiral staircase to the bedrooms. Not easy for all travelers.
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Belize, but definitely not our last! We were scheduled to vacation there a year ago but had to cancel that trip. We left our deposit on the books with Xanadu and excitedly re-scheduled for this year. Due to my miscommunication with them about our reservation, we ended up staying in three different units while there, but that was fine with us as we got to compare and contrast and have a better idea of which unit we will request when (not if) we return. As many others have already said, the staff at Xanadu is superb.....they are genuinely concerned about the comfort and happiness of their guests. Tiffany, Jamil and Orlando always greeted us with big smiles and warm conversation. The Belizeans in general are happy, friendly people and when you say no, the vendors don't harass you to buy their wares......the usual response was "Well, maybe next time! Thank you for visiting our country!" They are very appreciative of tourists there!
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Ecological Divers for several dives and also a snorkel trip to Shark Ray Alley. They, too, were wonderful to deal with.....very safety conscious, but still fun. Our trip to the Esmeralda site allowed us to see nurse sharks, stingrays, green eels, sea urchins, and many beautiful fish and corals! It was just awesome!
reviews.title: spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the ceviche at Fido's (and the relaxed atmosphere) and ate at Blue Water Grill several times because everything we ordered there was SO tasty! The highlight (food-wise) for us though, was the gibnut prepared especially at our request by Norman at El Fagon. He was a gracious host and we loved getting to know him.
reviews.title: Paradise With Wonderful Staff and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Xanadu met all of our expectations. We loved the peaceful retreat-like feel of the resort and the "step out your door" proximity to the beach. The rooms were lovely. Pool was wonderful, and the lounge chairs placed strategically under the palms were perfect. The staff was always eager to help. The access to snorkeling and sea kayaking was very convenient. We would stay there again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as usual we love going back to this friendly cozy home in the tropics....home is the right word. third time at the xanadu , and we already booked our forth time in september 2011. we are lucky enough to live in mexico, only 5 hours from the boat to san pedro, and we try to go back 2 times a year. the staff is incredible. Blanca, Tiffany, Jamil, Mr. Martin, Orlando, John and the cleaning staff all make you feel at home. I've been to many resorts around the world, ifrom 2 stars to 5 stars, but NEVER met a place quite like the Xanadu.....we are coming back in september, guys!
reviews.title: the best! now improved with heated pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: for the third time in one year we stayed at the xanadu resort. the prior two times management and staff were excellent, I did not believe that the excellence could improve, but it has! The friendly management and staff have made this my home away from home and totally cater to every want and need of their clients. This particular time my microwave went out and in 4 minutes the microwave was replaced. Again we thank Mr. Martin, Tiffany, Blanca, Jamil , Orlando and the cleaning staff for another wonderful stay in paradise.
reviews.title: 6 stars again....and new heated pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a week at Xanadu and truly enjoyed it. The facilities were kept very clean. The staff was always very nice and helpful whenever we needed it. While there are good restaurants only a few minutes away, we enjoyed the leisurely 20-minute walk along the beach to get to the central portion of San Pedro.
reviews.title: Lovely accomodations with very friendly & helpful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at Xanadu in August and had the best vacation yet! We frequent SanPedro once a year and this was by far the best place to stay! The staff is very accomidating, the grounds are immaculate, and it is like you are in your own piece of paradise. Xanadu provides bikes to get to town in, kayaks to use, and a beautiful palapa bar near the pool. We went fishing and used the grill after each catch. Can't say enough positive things about the stay.
reviews.title: Tropical Splendor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment I inquired about availability many months ago, until our trip at the end of February/beginning of March, Blanca and Tiffany were efficient, accomodating, and a pleasure to work with in making our reservations and planning our stay. All of our excursions were booked prior to our arrival, and Jamil also made sure we were comfortable with our rooms, including purchasing a case of water for us to have in the fridge upon our arrival! Don't miss Collin's Lamanai tour, and Vitalino and Harrsion were perfect guides for the cave tubing and zip lining activities. The condo was exceptionally clean, and no details were underlooked. In fact, we tried to make coffee with the coffee pot in the kitchen the day of our arrival, and it was no longer operating. Our hosts returned with a brand new, in the box coffee maker within 1/2 hour! That's service! We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Magical Place and Oustanding Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Xanadu. The rooms were clean and even had a water spout at the bottom of the stairs to rinse off sand. We rented a golf cart and found it to be a good location from town. It's close enough to walk but also not so close that it becomes too noisy. They had a nice pier for boats to pick you up for excursions.
reviews.title: Cute rooms and nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no restaurant on site but each room has a kitchen so it's easy to go shopping and prepare your own meals. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were clean as well.
reviews.title: A beautiful respite with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had lil' alphonse for the snorkel tour and it was the most rewarding snorkel trip we have ever taken. The coral in belize is still really healthy and the abundance of fish was amazing!
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Xanadu with another couple with the aim of relaxation and some adventure. We found both! The resort is beautiful, very well maintained, and very relaxing. The service was wonderful! Jamil and Tiffany did a superb job of recommending and booking our activities and dining. We really were able to totally relax and enjoy. We miss it already!
reviews.title: A piece of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, daughter and I spent 5 days at Xanadu following a week in the interior of Belize and Guatamala. We were met at the airport and greeted on our arrival by a cordial and enthusiastic staff. Our room was upgraded to an ocean-ront condo with a full kitchen, two bedrooms, and two nicely appointed baths. The condo was immaculate and well maintained. There is a nice pool, small beach, and an "activity desk" for booking snorkeling trips and other excursions. They were also very helpful in suggesting restaurants and making reservations for us. The hotel also offers free use of bicycles and kayaks. We were able to explore the reef via kayak from the hotel. It is a 10 - 15 minute walk along the beach into downtown San Pedro for restaurants, shops and bars.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel on Ambergris Caye

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we would stay there again in a heartbeat. The staff was wonderful and very helpful.
reviews.title: Xanadu is perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews that say you cannot go wrong by staying at Xanadu. The grounds and rooms are beautiful and the people there could not be friendlier or more helpful. The location is great because you are just a walk away from San Pedro but far enough away that it is quiet and peaceful. We stayed in the studio suite and it was very spacious and had a well equipped kitchen. The kitchen was perfect because we are divers and could make our coffee and breakfast so we could be out on the dock for early boat rides. The other plus for divers is the free use of outdoor lockers to hang your dive stuff. The locker area has a good rinse area for your gear and secure storage-very helpful. Good grocery store about three minute walk away. Xanadu makes everything about your stay very easy.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: What takes this place to another level is the people. Tiffany and Jamil help you arrange tours or whatever you need and everything they pointed us to was great. Orlando keeps the place beautiful and is perhaps the friendliest person you will ever meet and can answer any question you have about the island.
reviews.title: Excitement, Quiet, Comfort- all in one spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some reviews question the lack of a restaurant on property. This is no problem and frankly is a good thing because the resort is not large and a restaurant would just add noise. There are fine restaurants and bars within a five minute walk down the beach in either direction. When you want to go further away, cabs cost just five bucks U.S. and the desk can call one for you or you just walk out the front of the resort and wave one down. It never took more than two minutes to get a cab. If you do need a beer or soda while hanging around the pool or beach you can get one at the front desk for about the same price as the grocery, so no need for a bar. In short, you have everything you need at Xanadu and can get to whatever else you want in minutes. I would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Nothing Better.

description: Xanadu Island Resort lies hidden on an inviting palm lined beach, overlooking the Caribbean Sea and the Barrier Reef. Just a short walk to San Pedro Town, Xanadu Island Resort is close enough to enjoy the restaurants and other amenities of town, yet far enough from the hustle and bustle to be quiet and relaxed. All 18 of our luxurious condominium suites offer fully equipped kitchens and living/dining areas. Each suite is air conditioned, has cable TV, telephones, complimentary Wi-Fi and ethernet internet access, safes for valuables, hair dryers, IPOD docking stations, beach towels, large shaded decks with table, chairs and hammock overlooking the ocean, pool and/or gardens.
